{"content":"The following is the commit files that have changed: [
  {
    "sha": "f013846f51cfea439e905567f48146c0fd92d194",
    "filename": "docs/external-id/customers/concept-authentication-methods-customers.md",
    "status": "modified",
    "additions": 8,
    "deletions": 0,
    "changes": 8,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/6529906a3c8f9dddaf5000a4af5c737e4d9e1c82/docs%2Fexternal-id%2Fcustomers%2Fconcept-authentication-methods-customers.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/6529906a3c8f9dddaf5000a4af5c737e4d9e1c82/docs%2Fexternal-id%2Fcustomers%2Fconcept-authentication-methods-customers.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fexternal-id%2Fcustomers%2Fconcept-authentication-methods-customers.md?ref=6529906a3c8f9dddaf5000a4af5c737e4d9e1c82",
    "patch": "@@ -38,6 +38,14 @@ Email sign-up is enabled by default in your local account identity provider sett\n \n When you [create a sign-up and sign-in user flow](how-to-user-flow-sign-up-sign-in-customers.md#create-and-customize-a-user-flow), **Email with password** is the default option.\n \n+## Username or alias sign-in (preview)\n+\n+You can enable users who sign in with a local account (email and password) to sign in with an [alias or username](how-to-sign-in-alias.md) in addition to their email address. This allows users to authenticate using either their email address or an alternative identifier or both. The alternative identifier can be a customer ID, membership ID, insurance number, or frequent flyer number or anything similar that you want to use as a username.\n+\n+When you enable username sign-in, users can choose to sign in with either their email address or their username. If they choose to sign in with their username, they will be prompted to enter a password, similar to Email and password sign-in. If you [enable password reset](how-to-customize-branding-customers.md#to-customize-self-service-password-reset), users can reset their password by selecting the password reset link on the sign-in page.\n+\n+   :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/how-to-sign-in-alias/alias-sign-in.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the username sign-in option.\":::\n+\n ## Email with one-time passcode sign-in\n \n Email with one-time passcode is an option in your local account identity provider settings. With this option, the user signs in with a temporary passcode instead of a stored password each time they sign in."
  },
  {
    "sha": "3c79584e1e46edb2b57e3981a282f2dc5a6eb114",
    "filename": "docs/external-id/customers/how-to-sign-in-alias.md",
    "status": "added",
    "additions": 224,
    "deletions": 0,
    "changes": 224,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/6529906a3c8f9dddaf5000a4af5c737e4d9e1c82/docs%2Fexternal-id%2Fcustomers%2Fhow-to-sign-in-alias.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/6529906a3c8f9dddaf5000a4af5c737e4d9e1c82/docs%2Fexternal-id%2Fcustomers%2Fhow-to-sign-in-alias.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fexternal-id%2Fcustomers%2Fhow-to-sign-in-alias.md?ref=6529906a3c8f9dddaf5000a4af5c737e4d9e1c82",
    "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,224 @@\n+---\n+title: Sign in with alias\n+description: Learn how to Sign in with alias/username with External ID for customer identity and access management (CIAM). Get detailed steps to enable username as a sign-in identifier and create users with both email address and username. \n+ms.author: cmulligan\n+author: csmulligan\n+manager: dougeby\n+ms.service: entra-external-id \n+ms.subservice: external\n+ms.topic: how-to\n+ms.date: 09/10/2025\n+ms.custom: it-pro\n+\n+#Customer intent: As a dev, devops, or it admin, I want to learn about how to enable sign in with alias/username through the Microsoft Entra admin center and Graph API.\n+---\n+# Sign in with an alias or username (preview)\n+\n+[!INCLUDE [applies-to-external-only](../includes/applies-to-external-only.md)]\n+\n+You can allow users who sign in with an email address and password to also sign in with a username and password. The username, also called an alternate sign-in identifier, can be a customer ID, account number, or another identifier that you choose to use as a username.\n+\n+:::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/how-to-sign-in-alias/username-login-option.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the username sign-in option.\":::\n+\n+## Prerequisites\n+\n+- If you haven't already created your own Microsoft Entra external tenant, [create one now](how-to-create-external-tenant-portal.md).\n+- [Register an app](/entra/identity-platform/quickstart-register-app)\n+- [Create a user flow](how-to-user-flow-sign-up-sign-in-customers.md)\n+- [Add your application](how-to-user-flow-add-application.md) to the user flow.\n+\n+## Enable username in sign-in identifier policy\n+\n+To enable username as a sign-in identifier, first enable the sign-in identifier policy in the Microsoft Entra admin center. UserPrincipalName (UPN) and email address are selected by default. Once username is also  enabled, users who have been assigned a username will be able to sign in using either their email address or username.\n+\n+1. Sign in to the [Microsoft Entra admin center](https://entra.microsoft.com) as at least an [Authentication Policy Administrator](/entra/identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference#authentication-policy-administrator).\n+1. If you have access to multiple tenants, use the **Settings** icon :::image type=\"icon\" source=\"media/common/admin-center-settings-icon.png\" border=\"false\"::: in the top menu to switch to your external tenant from the **Directories + subscriptions** menu.\n+1. Browse to **Sign-in identifiers** either from **Entra ID** > **External Identities** or from **Entra ID** > **Authentication methods**.\n+\n+   :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/how-to-sign-in-alias/sign-in-identifiers-option.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Sign-in identifiers option in the Microsoft Entra admin center.\":::\n+\n+1. On the **Sign-in identifiers** page, enable **Username** as a sign-in identifier.\n+\n+   :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/how-to-sign-in-alias/enable-username.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of enabling username in the Sign-in identifiers option in the Microsoft Entra admin center.\":::\n+\n+1. Select **Save** at the top of the page.\n+\n+### Enable custom username validation (optional)\n+\n+You can also validate usernames against a custom regular expression. In the modal window, you can specify up to two regular expressions. There’s no built-in validation for custom regular expressions, apart from ensuring they don’t match the format of an email address. Authentication may fail at runtime if the provided value doesn’t match the regex or if the regex itself is invalid.\n+\n+1. To enable custom username validation, select **Customize** and **Enable** and specify the regex patterns.\n+\n+    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/how-to-sign-in-alias/enable-custom-username.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of enabling custom username in the Sign-in identifiers option in the Microsoft Entra admin center.\":::\n+\n+1. Select **Save** at the bottom of the modal window.\n+\n+## Create users with username in the admin center\n+\n+You can create external users with both email address and username as sign-in identifiers using either the Microsoft Entra admin center or the Microsoft Graph API. This section describes creating users in the Microsoft Entra admin center.\n+ \n+1. Sign in to the [Microsoft Entra admin center](https://entra.microsoft.com) as at least an [Authentication Policy Administrator](/entra/identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference#authentication-policy-administrator).\n+1. If you have access to multiple tenants, use the **Settings** icon :::image type=\"icon\" source=\"media/common/admin-center-settings-icon.png\" border=\"false\"::: in the top menu to switch to your external tenant from the **Directories + subscriptions** menu.\n+1. In your external tenant, browse to **Entra ID** > **Users**.\n+1. Select **+ New user** > **Create external user**.\n+1. Next to **Identities**, enter values for both **Email** and **User Name** sign-in methods. The selection order doesn’t matter.\n+\n+   :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/how-to-sign-in-alias/sign-in-method-dropdown.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Sign-in method dropdown in the Create external user pane in the Microsoft Entra admin center.\":::\n+\n+1. On the **Properties** tab, specify the email attribute for the user.\n+\n+   :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/how-to-sign-in-alias/email-attribute.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of the Email attribute field in the Create external user pane in the Microsoft Entra admin center.\":::\n+\n+1. Select **Review + create** to create the user.\n+\n+## Update existing users to add a username in the admin center\n+\n+Follow these steps to add a username to an existing external user in the Microsoft Entra admin center. Username can only be added to external users with email and password accounts.\n+\n+1. Sign in to the [Microsoft Entra admin center](https://entra.microsoft.com) as at least an [Authentication Policy Administrator](/entra/identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference#authentication-policy-administrator).\n+1. If you have access to multiple tenants, use the **Settings** icon :::image type=\"icon\" source=\"media/common/admin-center-settings-icon.png\" border=\"false\"::: in the top menu to switch to your external tenant from the **Directories + subscriptions** menu.\n+1. In your external tenant, browse to **Entra ID** > **Users**.\n+1. Select the external user you want to update.\n+1. In the user pane, select **Edit properties**.\n+1. On the **Identity** tab, in the **Identities** section select **+ Add identity**.\n+1. Select **User Name** from the dropdown and enter the username you want to assign to the user.\n+\n+   :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/how-to-sign-in-alias/edit-user-to-add-alias.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of adding username to an existing user in the Microsoft Entra admin center.\":::\n+\n+1. Select **Save** to apply the changes.\n+\n+## Create users with username with the Microsoft Graph API\n+\n+After you sign in to the [MS Graph explorer](https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/graph/graph-explorer), you can use the [Users API](/graph/api/user-post-users) to create users with both email address and username as sign-in identifiers. You can also use the Users API to [add a username](#add-a-username-to-existing-users-with-the-microsoft-graph-api) to an existing user.\n+The following request example shows how to create a user with both email address and username as sign-in identifiers.\n+\n+```http\n+POST https://graph.microsoft.com/v1.0/users\n+Content-type: application/json\n+{\n+    \"displayName\": \"Test User\",\n+    \"identities\": [\n+        {\n+            \"signInType\": \"emailAddress\",\n+            \"issuer\": \"contoso.onmicrosoft.com\",\n+            \"issuerAssignedId\": \"dylan@woodgrovebank.com\"\n+        },\n+        {\n+            \"signInType\": \"username\",\n+            \"issuer\": \"contoso.onmicrosoft.com\",\n+            \"issuerAssignedId\": \"dylan123\"\n+        }\n+    ],\n+    \"mail\": \"dylan@woodgrovebank.com\",\n+    \"passwordProfile\": {\n+        \"password\": \"passwordValue\",\n+        \"forceChangePasswordNextSignIn\": false\n+    },\n+    \"passwordPolicies\": \"DisablePasswordExpiration\"\n+}\n+```\n+\n+## Add a username to existing users with the Microsoft Graph API\n+\n+You can also add a username to an existing external user.\n+\n+### Step 1: Get the user details\n+\n+Use `$filter` to get the user object, and `$select` to return the ID and `identities[]` properties. The following request example shows how to retrieve a user account using the email address as a sign-in identifier.\n+\n+```http\n+GET https://graph.microsoft.com/v1.0/users?$select=displayName,id,identities&$filter=identities/any(c:c/issuerAssignedId eq 'dylan@woodgrovebank.com' and c/issuer eq 'contoso.onmicrosoft.com')\n+```\n+\n+The following response example shows the response with the user details.\n+\n+```http\n+HTTP/1.1 200 OK\n+Content-type: application/json\n+ \n+{\n+    \"@odata.context\": \"https://graph.microsoft.com/v1.0/$metadata#users(displayName,id,identities)\",\n+    \"value\": [\n+        {\n+            \"displayName\": \"ciam test 1\",\n+            \"id\": \"0daaf9dd-3583-4cd4-8934-a2ffd0490287\",\n+            \"identities\": [\n+                {\n+                    \"signInType\": \"userPrincipalName\",\n+                    \"issuer\": \"contoso.onmicrosoft.com\",\n+                    \"issuerAssignedId\": \"0daaf9dd-3583-4cd4-8934-a2ffd0490287@contoso.onmicrosoft.com\"\n+                },\n+                {\n+                    \"signInType\": \"emailAddress\",\n+                    \"issuer\": \"contoso.onmicrosoft.com\",\n+                    \"issuerAssignedId\": \"dylan@woodgrovebank.com\"\n+                }\n+            ]\n+        }\n+    ]\n+}\n+```\n+\n+### Step 2: Update the user details\n+\n+Once you have the user details from the query above, you can update the `identities[]` property of the user. You must replace the entire `identities[]` property of the user.\n+\n+The following request example shows how to update the `identities[]` property of the user to add a username.\n+\n+```http\n+POST https://graph.microsoft.com/v1.0/users/00aa00aa-bb11-cc22-dd33-44ee44ee44ee\n+Content-type: application/json \n+{\n+            \"identities\": [\n+                {\n+                    \"signInType\": \"userPrincipalName\",\n+                    \"issuer\": \"contoso.onmicrosoft.com\",\n+                    \"issuerAssignedId\": \"00aa00aa-bb11-cc22-dd33-44ee44ee44ee@contoso.onmicrosoft.com\"\n+                },\n+                {\n+                    \"signInType\": \"emailAddress\",\n+                    \"issuer\": \"contoso.onmicrosoft.com\",\n+                    \"issuerAssignedId\": \"dylan@woodgrovebank.com\"\n+                },\n+                {\n+                    \"signInType\": \"userName\",\n+                    \"issuer\": \"contoso.onmicrosoft.com\",\n+                    \"issuerAssignedId\": \"dylan1234\"\n+                }\n+            ]\n+}\n+```\n+\n+## Test signing in with the alias or username\n+\n+You can test signing in with the email address and username you assigned to the user you created using the [Run user flow](how-to-test-user-flows.md) feature.\n+\n+> [!NOTE]\n+> The `identities[]` property on a user object isn’t enforced by the Microsoft Entra sign-in identifiers policy. While administrators can assign values to a user’s `identities[]` property, authentication is determined by the configured sign-in identifier policy. In other words, if a sign-in type is specified for a user but isn't enabled in the policy, the authentication attempt fails at runtime. For example, a user might be assigned the username *User1234*, but if the username sign-in method isn't enabled in the policy, the user won't be able to sign in using that username.  \n+\n+## Customize the sign-in page (optional)\n+\n+You can customize the sign-in page to provide a better experience for your users. You can customize the hint text of the identifier field on the sign-in page and localize other strings related to username.\n+\n+### Customize the hint text of the identifier field on the sign-in page\n+\n+You can customize the hint text of identifier field on the sign-in page for all apps via [Custom branding](/entra/external-id/customers/how-to-customize-branding-customers#to-customize-the-sign-in-form).\n+\n+1. Sign in to the [Microsoft Entra admin center](https://entra.microsoft.com) as at least a [Organizational Branding Administrator](~/identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#organizational-branding-administrator).\n+1. If you have access to multiple tenants, use the **Settings** icon :::image type=\"icon\" source=\"media/common/admin-center-settings-icon.png\" border=\"false\"::: in the top menu to switch to the external tenant you created earlier from the **Directories + subscriptions** menu.\n+1. Browse to **Company branding** either by using the search bar or by navigating to **Entra ID** > **Custom Branding**.\n+1. Select **Edit** to modify the branding.\n+1. In the **Sign-in form** tab, you can customize the hint text of identifier field on the sign-in page. For example, you can change it to *Email address or Member ID*.\n+\n+   :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/how-to-sign-in-alias/edit-username-hint.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of customizing the username hint text  in the Microsoft Entra admin center.\":::\n+\n+1. Select **Review + save** to save your changes.\n+\n+### Customize and localize other strings related to username\n+\n+You can customize and localize other strings related to an end user's experience of signing in with a username by uploading a language file. For more information, see [Add language customization to a user flow](/entra/external-id/customers/how-to-customize-languages-customers#add-language-customization-to-a-user-flow).\n+\n+## Related content\n+\n+- You can use the [Users API](/graph/api/user-post-users) to create users with both email address and username with Microsoft Graph.\n+- You can [customize the look and feel of the authentication experience for the external tenant](/entra/external-id/customers/concept-branding-customers#add-language-customization-to-a-user-flow)."
  },

  {
    "sha": "6c3ef4ac114a7ccf09578931b6b81f32c84276b7",
    "filename": "docs/identity/authentication/how-to-authentication-external-method-manage.md",
    "status": "modified",
    "additions": 10,
    "deletions": 0,
    "changes": 10,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/6529906a3c8f9dddaf5000a4af5c737e4d9e1c82/docs%2Fidentity%2Fauthentication%2Fhow-to-authentication-external-method-manage.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/6529906a3c8f9dddaf5000a4af5c737e4d9e1c82/docs%2Fidentity%2Fauthentication%2Fhow-to-authentication-external-method-manage.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fidentity%2Fauthentication%2Fhow-to-authentication-external-method-manage.md?ref=6529906a3c8f9dddaf5000a4af5c737e4d9e1c82",
    "patch": "@@ -172,6 +172,16 @@ EAMs and custom controls can operate in parallel. Microsoft recommends that admi\n \n Include a test group of users for each policy, but not both. If a user is included in both policies, or any policy with both conditions, the user has to satisfy MFA during sign-in. They also have to satisfy the custom control, which makes them redirected to the external provider a second time.\n \n+## FAQ\n+### 1. Why doesn't External Authentication Methods (EAM) work on Windows 10 during device setup?\n+**Answer:**  \n+If you are setting up a device running **Windows 10** using an **EAM-only identity**, you may encounter an issue where the **Out-of-Box (OOB) setup experience** fails and prevents you from proceeding with sign-in.\n+\n+This behavior occurs because **Windows 10 does not natively support EAM during OOBE (Out-of-Box Experience)**.  \n+Microsoft no longer supports Windows 10 (https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/end-of-support?msockid=26a3312b6b246f501ec624846a4f6e11), and there are **no plans to extend EAM support** to it.\n+\n+To use External Authentication Methods for sign-in, **upgrade to Windows 11**\n+\n ## Next steps\n \n For more information about how to manage authentication methods, see [Manage authentication methods for Microsoft Entra ID](/entra/identity/authentication/concept-authentication-methods-manage)."
  },

    "patch": "@@ -4,7 +4,7 @@\n   items:\n   - name: What is a device identity?\n     href: overview.md\n-  - name: Whats new in Linux for devices\n+  - name: What's new in Linux for devices\n     href: whats-new-linux.md\n - name: Tutorials\n   expanded: false\n@@ -40,7 +40,7 @@\n     href: protecting-tokens-microsoft-entra-id.md \n   - name: macOS Platform Single Sign-on overview \n     href: macos-psso.md\n-  - name: Integrate macOS Platform Single Sign-On (PSSO) into your MDM solution\n+  - name: Integrate macOS Platform single sign-on (PSSO) into your MDM solution\n     href: macos-psso-integration-guide.md\n   - name: Microsoft Single Sign-on to Linux\n     href: sso-linux.md\n@@ -123,6 +123,11 @@\n     items:\n     - name: Configure Microsoft Entra hybrid join manually\n       href: hybrid-join-manual.md\n+  - name: Third-Party device management\n+    expanded: false\n+    items:\n+    - name: Browser access guidance for third party mobile device management providers\n+      href: browser-access-guidance-third-party-devices.md    \n   - name: Enforce TLS 1.2\n     href: reference-device-registration-tls-1-2.md\n   - name: Microsoft Graph APIs"

  {
    "sha": "2c58e46a403b24ab365aef75dd6cfa9998506fbb",
    "filename": "docs/identity/devices/browser-access-guidance-third-party-devices.md",
    "status": "added",
    "additions": 72,
    "deletions": 0,
    "changes": 72,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/6529906a3c8f9dddaf5000a4af5c737e4d9e1c82/docs%2Fidentity%2Fdevices%2Fbrowser-access-guidance-third-party-devices.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/6529906a3c8f9dddaf5000a4af5c737e4d9e1c82/docs%2Fidentity%2Fdevices%2Fbrowser-access-guidance-third-party-devices.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fidentity%2Fdevices%2Fbrowser-access-guidance-third-party-devices.md?ref=6529906a3c8f9dddaf5000a4af5c737e4d9e1c82",
    "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,72 @@\n+---\n+title: Browser access guidance for third party mobile device management providers\n+description: As an MDM provider, I want to update my Android Device policy to enable browser access during device registration so that my customers can access CA-protected resources seamlessly.\n+ms.service: entra-id\n+ms.subservice: devices\n+ms.topic: reference\n+ms.date: 10/15/2025\n+ms.author: owinfrey\n+author: owinfreyATL\n+manager: dougeby\n+ms.reviewer: zhvolosh\n+\n+---\n+\n+\n+# Browser access guidance for third party mobile device management providers\n+\n+Update your [Android Device policy](https://developers.google.com/android/management/reference/rest/v1/enterprises.policies) resource to support automatically enabling browser access during device registration.\n+\n+As announced in September 2024 and November 2025 in the What’s New in Microsoft Entra blog, we're automatically enabling browser access by default for Android users. This change is part of hardening all Microsoft products as part of the [Secure Future Initiative](https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-cloud/resources/secure-future-initiative). As part of this initiative, we're eliminating the mechanism to export device registration keys from device storage after registration completes. \n+\n+\n+This change means that users of Android devices will no longer be able to modify their browser access settings in Authenticator app or Company Portal after their device has been registered in Microsoft Entra ID. Instead, Android users have browser access enabled by default. \n+\n+## If you're an MDM provider\n+\n+\n+We request that you modify your [Android Device policy](https://developers.google.com/android/management/reference/rest/v1/enterprises.policies) resource to support enabling browser access during device registration. The policy resource is used to create and save groups of device and app management settings for your customers to apply to devices.\n+\n+To enable browser access on behalf of your customers, you need to either create or modify an existing policy to provide a delegated certificate to the Authenticator app and Company Portal. \n+\n+The following is an example of a policy: \n+\n+**Policy example for setting delegated scope CERT_INSTALL for authenticator**\n+\n+\n+```html\n+\"applications\": [{\n+    \"packageName\": \"com.azure.authenticator\"\n+    \"installType\": \"REQUIRED_FOR_SETUP\"\n+    \"delegatedScopes\": [\n+        \"CERT_INSTALL\"\n+      ]   \n+}],\n+```\n+\n+CERT_INSTALL - Grants access to certificate installation and management. - https://developer.android.com/reference/android/app/admin/DevicePolicyManager#DELEGATION_CERT_INSTALL\n+\n+\n+More information can be found here: [Android MDM create and apply policy](https://microsoft.sharepoint-df.com/:w:/t/AzureADDevices/EUBvQT-nqK1GhgrNwoOsUbYBUfCGH0uZM7bLQBPS56bggw?e=UvUuF0).\n+\n+\n+If you fail to make the requested change, your end users encounter the following behavior: \n+\n+-\tIf the device is registered in Microsoft Entra with Browser Access enabled\n+    - No effect \n+-\tIf the device is registered in Microsoft Entra but Browser Access isn't enabled: \n+    - Access to CA-protected resources on a non Microsoft Edge browser will be blocked.\n+    - If the user requires access to CA-protected resources on a web browser, they'll have to use Microsoft Edge. \n+-\tIf the device is undergoing registration for the first time: \n+    - The user is prompted to choose a certificate type and name their certificate as part of the registration flow. \n+    - This certificate is used to enable browser access. \n+    - Once this certificate is on the device, browser access is enabled, and the user can access CA-protected resources on any browser of their choice. \n+\n+\n+:::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/browser-access-guidance-third-party-devices/device-certificates.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of setting device certificates.\" lightbox=\"media/browser-access-guidance-third-party-devices/device-certificates.png\":::\n+\n+\n+\n+## Related content\n+\n+- [What's new in Microsoft Entra - September 2024](https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/blog/microsoft-entra-blog/whats-new-in-microsoft-entra---september-2024/4253153)"
  },

    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/6529906a3c8f9dddaf5000a4af5c737e4d9e1c82/docs%2Fidentity%2Fdevices%2Fmedia%2Fbrowser-access-guidance-third-party-devices%2Fdevice-certificates.png",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fidentity%2Fdevices%2Fmedia%2Fbrowser-access-guidance-third-party-devices%2Fdevice-certificates.png?ref=6529906a3c8f9dddaf5000a4af5c737e4d9e1c82"
  },
  {
    "sha": "d0343fede79aef9e5454c217f4f8fb3557b71405",
    "filename": "docs/identity/enterprise-apps/disable-user-sign-in-portal.md",
    "status": "modified",
    "additions": 1,
    "deletions": 1,
    "changes": 2,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/6529906a3c8f9dddaf5000a4af5c737e4d9e1c82/docs%2Fidentity%2Fenterprise-apps%2Fdisable-user-sign-in-portal.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/6529906a3c8f9dddaf5000a4af5c737e4d9e1c82/docs%2Fidentity%2Fenterprise-apps%2Fdisable-user-sign-in-portal.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fidentity%2Fenterprise-apps%2Fdisable-user-sign-in-portal.md?ref=6529906a3c8f9dddaf5000a4af5c737e4d9e1c82",
    "patch": "@@ -19,7 +19,7 @@ zone_pivot_groups: enterprise-apps-all\n ---\n # Disable user sign-in for an application\n \n-There might be situations while configuring or managing an application where you don't want tokens to be issued for an application. Or, you might want to block an application that you don't want your employees to try to access. To block user access to an application, you can disable user sign-in for the application, which prevents all tokens from being issued for that application.\n+There might be situations while configuring or managing an application where you don't want tokens to be issued for an application. Or, you might want to block an application that you don't want your employees to try to access, like the deprecated Azure AD PowerShell modules (AppID 1b730954-1685-4b74-9bfd-dac224a7b894). To block user access to an application, you can disable user sign-in for the application, which prevents all tokens from being issued for that application.\n \n In this article, you learn how to prevent users from signing in to an application in Microsoft Entra ID through both the Microsoft Entra admin center and PowerShell. If you're looking for how to block specific users from accessing an application, use [user or group assignment](./assign-user-or-group-access-portal.md).\n "
  },
  {
    "sha": "a06ae8a68d3c5e20de2277d785282de00d77e86e",
    "filename": "docs/identity/enterprise-apps/manage-app-consent-policies.md",
    "status": "modified",
    "additions": 1,
    "deletions": 1,
    "changes": 2,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/6529906a3c8f9dddaf5000a4af5c737e4d9e1c82/docs%2Fidentity%2Fenterprise-apps%2Fmanage-app-consent-policies.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/6529906a3c8f9dddaf5000a4af5c737e4d9e1c82/docs%2Fidentity%2Fenterprise-apps%2Fmanage-app-consent-policies.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fidentity%2Fenterprise-apps%2Fmanage-app-consent-policies.md?ref=6529906a3c8f9dddaf5000a4af5c737e4d9e1c82",
    "patch": "@@ -64,7 +64,7 @@ The setting labeled \"Let Microsoft manage your consent settings,\" the Microsoft\n Updates to this consent policy will have at least 30 days of given notice.\n \n > [!NOTE]\n-> Starting at the end of October 2025, the Microsoft managed policy will be updated to require admin consent for the following MS Graph permissions: Mail.Read, Mail.ReadWrite, Mail.ReadBasic, Mail.Read.Shared, Mail.ReadBasic.Shared, Mail.ReadWrite.Shared, MailboxItem.Read, Calendars.Read, Calendars.ReadBasic, Calendars.ReadWrite, Calendars.Read.Shared, Calendars.ReadBasic.Shared, Calendars.ReadWrite.Shared, Chat.Read, Chat.ReadWrite, ChannelMessage.Read.All,OnlineMeetings.Read, OnlineMeetings.ReadWrite, OnlineMeetingTranscript.Read.All, OnlineMeetingsRecording.Read.All. At the end of November 2025, this will expand to include EAS.AccessAsUser.All, EWS.AccessAsUser.All, IMAP.AcessAsUser.All, POP.AccessAsUser.All\n+> Starting at the end of October 2025, the Microsoft managed policy will be updated to require admin consent for the following MS Graph permissions: Mail.Read, Mail.ReadWrite, Mail.ReadBasic, Mail.Read.Shared, Mail.ReadBasic.Shared, Mail.ReadWrite.Shared, MailboxItem.Read, Calendars.Read, Calendars.ReadBasic, Calendars.ReadWrite, Calendars.Read.Shared, Calendars.ReadBasic.Shared, Calendars.ReadWrite.Shared, Chat.Read, Chat.ReadWrite, ChannelMessage.Read.All, OnlineMeetings.Read, OnlineMeetings.ReadWrite, OnlineMeetingTranscript.Read.All, OnlineMeetingRecording.Read.All. At the end of November 2025, this will expand to include EAS.AccessAsUser.All, EWS.AccessAsUser.All, IMAP.AccessAsUser.All, POP.AccessAsUser.All\n \n \n "
  },

]. Please summarise it in a few sentences, using UK grammar and ensure the response is formatted for markdown. Do not start the response with here is summary.","role":"user"}
ai_summary.Response: New documentation has been added for enabling users to sign in with a username or alias in addition to their email address, with comprehensive guides on configuration and user management via the Microsoft Entra admin centre and Graph API. Updates also include guidance for third-party mobile device management providers regarding browser access during device registration, and a clarification on an FAQ related to external authentication methods on Windows 10. Minor revisions have been made to existing documentation concerning disabling user sign-in for applications and app consent policies, along with some reviewer removals.
